description: RISK-006: Critical key-person dependency on the Lead Developer for all architecture and DirectX/GPU rendering tasks. Loss of this resource would halt the project.
mitigation_strategy: Mandate pair programming on the rendering pipeline (TASK-DICOM-003) and enforce comprehensive documentation for the POC (TASK-DICOM-002).
contingency_plan: Engage a pre-vetted graphics development contractor to take over or assist.
monitoring_trigger: Lead developer has an unplanned absence of more than 3 days.

description: The Frontend Developer is allocated at 120% of total capacity, with critical overloads in Sprints 2 and 4. This will lead to burnout, reduced quality, and guaranteed timeline slippage.
mitigation_strategy: Hire a second Senior WPF Developer to balance the workload. This is the primary recommendation.
contingency_plan: De-scope non-critical UI features from Sprint 2 (e.g., failed unlock counter) and Sprint 4 (e.g., Flip/Rotate tools) to a later release.
monitoring_trigger: More than two frontend tasks are carried over from Sprint 2 to Sprint 3.
resolution_timeline: 4 weeks to hire and onboard a new developer.
